result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory Ezra Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cory Ezra Bauer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cory Ezra Bauer was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)4.
  • Cory Ezra Bauer was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
9:36 AM Defendant Cory Ezra Bauer in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Cory Ezra Bauer.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that in 22CF295 defendant to plead to Counts 1 and 2. Count 3 in 22CF295 and 21CF529 to be dismissed. For Count 1 in 22CF295, 10 years prison fashioned as 6 years extended supervision and 4 years extended supervision with credit for 84 days and pay a $250 fine plus costs. For Count 2, 4 years prison fashioned as 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision. Concurrent with Count 1. Defendant eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. State asks that money seized from defendant during arrest be sent to COC to be applied to fines. Court will not order "drug money" to be applied to fines. 

Court imposes for Count 1 in 22CF295, 10 years prison fashioned as 6 years extended supervision and 4 years extended supervision with credit for 84 days and pay a $250 fine plus costs. For Count 2, 4 years prison fashioned as 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision credit of 84 days. Concurrent with Count 1.
Letter from Attorneys to Court re: Rescheduling of Bail/Bond hearing

9:20 AM Defendant Cory Ezra Bauer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal appeared by video for Cory Ezra Bauer.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court call case. Attorney acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty, asks for status and bail modification.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
8:59 AM Calling cases 22CF295 for preliminary hearing and 21CF529 for STC

Defendant Cory Ezra Bauer in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Cory Ezra Bauer.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Requests to be heard on bail. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. 
State is prepared to proceed on bail modification motion.
Attorney indicates client has been in custody for 12 days and unable to post requested amount.  May be able to post 2500.  Has made all court appearances on prior file that he represented him on. 
State opposes any modification at this point; serious charges.  class c felony.  maximum 40 years in prison.  Alleged to have happened when out on felony bail. Cites priors, probation revoked x3, fta's.
Court does not believe that anything has significantly changed since bail was set. Court denies bail modification.
Arraignment scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
